snifc
Interface SimulatorIfc

public interface SimulatorIfc

The SimulatorIfc represents the interface any simulator should implements Each step of the simulator is implemented through a hook method. Steps are triggered in that order - reset() - createSensors() - linkSensors() - runSensors() - showStats()

Author:
sfrenot

Method Summary
 void createSensors()
          Create sensors create sensors of the network.
 void linkSensors()
          Create links in the network
 void reset()
          The reset function is call when a new simulation is made.
 void runSensors()
          Runs the simulation.
 void showStat()
          At the end of a simultation, results are presented when that method is called
 

Method Detail

reset

public void reset()
The reset function is call when a new simulation is made. All parameters should be resetted to their simulation value. (TTL, QueueSize, Steps, MemorySize, Capture Frequency...)

createSensors

public void createSensors()
                   throws java.lang.Exception
Create sensors create sensors of the network.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception - If a sensor cannot be create
See Also:
SensorIfc

linkSensors

public void linkSensors()
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Create links in the network

Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if a link is not valid
See Also:
LinkIfc

runSensors

public void runSensors()
                throws java.lang.Exception
Runs the simulation. This is the main execution loop.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

showStat

public void showStat()
At the end of a simultation, results are presented when that method is called
